Reviews.Title: “First Time to Rome”
Reviews.Author: mrich53
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Rome and we did enjoy our stay. We are only giving the Polo 3 out of 5 for a few reasons. First, our experience with the staff was different than some other people's. We found them pleasant, helpful and they seemed sincerely happy to see us in the morning as we left for the day's excursions or in the evening when we returned home. The entire staff - from housekeeping, to the restaurant, to the people at the front desk - went out of their way to make us feel welcome and to be helpful. There was a small supermarket around the corner and the people were used to tourists from the hotel and they also helped to make our stay a pleasant one. (I hope this doesn't come across as arrogant, but after having travelled a bit, I find that simply asking someone their name, telling them yours and then trying to say please and thank you in their language will usually end up getting you better service - wherever you are). Is this hotel out of the way? Definitely yes, but it depends a little on your perspective. I was able to jog from the hotel to the coliseum in about 35 minutes. The closest metro is Flaminio which is fifteen minutes away, but the train station, Euclide, is only 5 minutes away and it is one stop away from Flaminio and the rest of the metro system - and it uses the same 1 euro ticket which is good for 75 minutes throughout the network of trains, buses and metros. The trains run every fifteen minutes during the day. A taxi from the hotel to the Coliseum at 4:30 in the afternoon cost me exactly 8.40 euros. You can walk from the hotel to even the farthest tourist site in the city in 45 minutes if you so choose, otherwise there are metro stops at most of the important sites. We walked everywhere we went and we used to enjoy our walks home at night long the Tevere (Tiber) river. I am 58 with arthritis in the knees and after walking up and down hills in Rome for two weeks, I actually lost a little weight and my knees were better for having had the exercise. It might, however, be harder for a senior or someone with small children because of the distances. This was my first trip to Europe and I found the room exceptionally small even though I had been warned. We had ants in our room, but in all fairness, the front desk did eventually send someone to deal with the problem once they had been informed. Later, however, while sitting in the armchair in the lobby, I suddenly felt three or four on my arms. The breakfast was adequate (the coffee was great), but they served the exact same limited, mediocre menu every day for two weeks which grew very tiresome. As I said, I have never been to Europe before, but I have stayed in 4 star hotels in Cuba, Japan, the US, the Philippines, and in Canada and when I do an overall comparison to the Polo Hotel, it just doesn't measure up as well. Even though Cuba is still under an embargo the breakfasts are generally more interesting, better prepared and more varied. There was great inexpensive fruit at the supermarket near the Polo, especially the gigantic seedless Italian grapes, but the fruit at breakfast was a little old and unappetizing. The TV had only about 10 channels, most of which were Italian with 2 or 3 Russian stations, one Spanish and CNN International in English. There were no films available to watch, not even for rental. The view from our room looked out on a junky area behind the hotel. The shower stall was a tight fit for one person, I wouldn't suggest trying to fit two. The hotel might be better off eliminating the biday and increasing the size of the shower. The internet service was reasonable priced and fairly reliable for WIFI. Bottom line: would I go back? Maybe yes, because of the staff and because all the walking caused me to see things I wouldn't have had I been staying at a downtown hotel. Would I recommend the hotel? Not at the prices we paid. This is simply not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not good location.”
Reviews.Author: DawnLouiseAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough. It was very clean and comfortable. However, the location is not so good. It is very far away from anything. We decided to walk it to the city which nice at first but then it became a bit tiring. We read on the reviews previously that the hotel staff were not so friendly. Well, they were right. It wasn't a language barrier because they could speak a bit of English and I could speak a bit of Italian. Even when communicating with them in their native tongue they were miserable and unhelpful. It looked as though they didn't want to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikey-G1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good business hotel which caters well for the traveller. The rooms are well appointed and the resturant serves a good breakfast and evening meal. The noise from ajoining rooms is a little loud and the wifi works better in some areas than others. The staff are knowledable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dated luxe, I liked it..”
Reviews.Author: jennieerin73
Reviews.Content: This hotel's decor is really dated -- late 60s' architecture and brown wood interiors -- which I kind of found cool. At the same time it's pretty luxurious. The hotel's general feel matches that of the quiet, rich surrounding neighborhood, which is the nicest I've stayed in in Rome. (There are just enough restaurants and boutiques and a Carrefour nearby for necessities). No gym or anything, and the internet is spotty in the rooms -- the outlets are old as well. But the service was friendly, and there's lots of it. Breakfast is passable. An easy walk to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Not near anything. Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: GATravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This was a relatively nice hotel but away from everything and in a residential district. Even the Villa Borghese was a long walk away. The rooms were clean but at least the ones we had included tiny bathrooms. Fabric walls were an interesting touch but it had water damage near the window which gave off a musty smell. We only stayed here briefly for tow night and spent most of our time sightseeing. Breakfast was just OK with a limited assortment of options compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Europe. The front desk clerk was not friendly but again it didn't matter since we weren't there very often. Even though this is an average hotel the location makes it undesirable to Rome's sites.

Reviews.Title: “Our family was very impressed with Polo Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissTexasTraveler
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with 2 adult "children" and spent 3 nights at the Polo Hotel. We flew in and took RomeCabs to the Polo Hotel for $55 euros. We mentioned to our driver how we are planning to buy the Roma Pass and he offered to wait for us after we checked in and take us to Termini Station to purchase them. We were welcomed with a smile and checked in to our 2 clean rooms. We checked in to room 309, with a small walk-out balcony and the view is facing the building across, facing their balconies as well. Room 312 has a basic window facing the street. We had all the basic toiletries, hair dryer, and a few extras such as shower caps and shoe shine buffers. The room and bathroom were very clean and each adult had their own little closet, set of drawers, in addition to a dresser. Cable channels were iffy, but who really wants to watch TV? Both rooms also had keyboards for internet access, at a fee. There is also a small fridge in the room and my tiny bottle of water was the only thing that fit (worked for me). We enjoyed breakfast and always had plenty to eat. We ate dinner there the first night because we were exhausted and were the only guests for dinner. We didn't see many guests and perhaps that is why there was always plenty to eat at breakfast. The hotel is not located in the city, but we had easy access to the train station and never had to wait long for a train (5 to 10 minute walk). One bus runs in front of the hotel, but we didn't take it. As you face out the front doors, there is a grocery store up the hill on the left. We went there about 3 times for water, fruit, and snacks. The walk from the train station to the hotel was nice and allowed us to talk about our day. We didn't mind the distance and enjoyed our stay at the Polo Hotel and hopefully you will as well.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly advice: Beware of that hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KyMartin
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible. The hotel management didn't keep its promises. If you need to stay in Rome, this is not a place to chose and you'd do better elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “bad experiences”
Reviews.Author: meekEurope
Reviews.Content: It s pitty that in the moment you want to rest in a place you need be affraid (unfortunately the right word) of the people who want to demonstrate their "power".. Me and my friends found some of the hotel"crew" very impolite and negative.. Instead of that ,don't think that your breakfast's coffee will ejoy you ..food it's also not their best strength.. So sorry to say that because of such people I can not have only good memmories from Rome.. Hope they will soon change the crew (especially man at the front desk)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a return trip”
Reviews.Author: boodleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polo hotel for 2 nights last week (Oct 15-16 2009) and overall were very pleased with the accommodations. As mentioned in some other reviews, the Polo is located in the Parioli Quarter just North of Villa Borghese and is just a few blocks South of Piazza Euclid, ...about a 5-6 minute walk to/from the hotel. Piazza Euclide is easily accessible and is only a 5-minute train ride from Piazza Di Populo. Just take the Viterbo suburban train one stop. There are a few small restaurants located in the square across from the train station and a small supermarket for supplies. There are also several buses that run from Termini station past the hotel and from Piazza del Popolo, bus 926 goes right by the hotel. The hotel room itself was small, but who came to Rome to stay in the room? The breakfast buffet was quite good and filling. We also found the hotel front desk personnel very helpful and glad to answer any questions we had. I would recommend this hotel, but if it’s your first time to Rome, try to stay closer to the attractions. Otherwise, I think it’s a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellers56
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was adequate but staff have a lot to learn about "customer service" and being pleasant to guests. We felt like we were an imposition and they had better things to do than their jobs!!! If you're a true tourist then this is too far out in the suburbs. Accommodation met our needs but we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “INhospitality in quiet residential setting”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelestraveling
Reviews.Content: After being stuck on the runway for almost 3 hours and arriving at our hotel after 2 in the morning, I was still willing to muster my best broken, yet polite, Italian upon arrival at the hotel. I never anticipated the rudeness with which we were greeted! By the end of the check -in process, my boyfriend and I felt as though we had been time-transported back to high school and we were going to be grounded for arriving past curfew! The clerk had absolutely no sympathy for our situation and went on to chastise us for missing the hotel car that I had reserved for our transportation. Absurdly, being on a severely delayed flight, stuck in the plane on the runway, these were not valid excuses for this guy...and forget about a warm welcome after a difficult trip! He went so far as to explain that these situations are exactly why he never travels. Weird... I thought people in the "hospitality industry" encouraged travel... The clerk on duty the following day was not any more welcoming, or even polite. The bottom line here, is that the treatment that we received by these two front desk clerks had a negative impact not only on our hotel stay, but also on our trip in general. I would have walked out and stayed somewhere else, had the room not been part of a package deal. Beyond the emotional distress, this hotel is generally okay. They do offer a good breakfast and the rooms are comfortable. The location should be taken into consideration, as other people have written here. It is not in the central area of Rome. Taking the train to the subway is easy, though the trains stop running by 9 or 10pm. Taxis have to be used after that. If you don't mind a little travel time, staying here will offer a quiet residential experience. Also, as another person wrote, the internet access was ellusive and the front desk only offered a neighborhood internet cafe. There is a bar around the corner that offers delicious snacks. Unfortunately, the service at the hotel left such a bitter taste in my mouth, I would never go back. I would feel weird about giving them my money.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in Roma”
Reviews.Author: ANGELO07
Reviews.Content: As it was my second travel to Roma I was a bit anxious about the accomodation since my last experience in another Parioli area hotel was terrible.What a surprise!!!Polo was almost just what we wanted.We were informed about the walking distance from main attractions and it was our choice to stay that far.It's about half our walking to Spagna via Villa Borgheze though the use of suburban from Euclide to Flaminio and continuing with metro is highly recommended.We never felt the rumble of metro in our room in 4th floor but it was clear at the breakfast floor.Just cute...The personnel was adequate,average kind and helpful.The room and generally the hotel was more than shiny clean.The room was small but well equipped,the bathroom small and yes,sitting in toilet is a bit complicated.Overweighted or just more than average dimensioned persons may have problems here.Some details as electric plugs in our room (403) need some check as they look somewhat harmful since they are worn or damaged.The neighborhood is marvellous and calm.There is a very good eating place called Ristart (ex-Angelica) a few steps from hotel next to the cinema.Fantastic tastes,the best tiramisu I've tried ever but a bit overpriced. We will keep this hotel in mind for any other future visit in Rome and undoubtefully we will suggest it to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Skyflier
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel before reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. After checking up on them I was worried for our stay in Rome, but came to find the room, staff and hotel in general was very good! As we came to check in (in the morning), we got the key to our room right away from a smiling and helpful lady behind the reception. No need to wait 'til after noon. The room was very nice. We had a triple, which meant 2 bedrooms, a hall and quite nice size on the bathroom. Yeah, I agree, the shower is cramped. But who needs room for ballet-lessons when showering? A brief walk north of the hotel was the metro, connecting us to the citycenter within minutes. We are not in great shape, but found the walk to be no problem. Maybe I was worried the hotel was going to be far from the 4 star rating that was given when I read the previous reviews, and therefore pleasantly surprised upon arrival. But we sure did not have much to complain about when we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcome to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Emmandkay
Reviews.Content: Quite an impressive-looking hotel in a good district just north of the Villa Borghese. However, although described as being in a tranquil area, it suffered from a lot of road noise, being sandwiched between two busy commuter streets. The public areas were well decorated and furnished, but our en-suite room was cramped, particularly the shower-room. The space between the wc pan and the shower screen was so narrow that one was forced to sit sideways to perform. The decor was tired, and the double-glazing had lost its seal, so that the entire picture window was opaque, and the soundproofing was impaired. On two evenings the water had to be run for over 5 minutes before it got warm, and on one night it steadfastly remained cold. The buffet breakfasts were good. For a city hotel it was generally adequate, but the most disappointing thing about the Polo was the total indifference of the staff to the presence of their guests. The reception staff and those in the breakfast room were invariably surly. Not once during our 3-night stay were we asked if everything was ok , and all our attempts at pleasantries, whether in English or broken Italian, were met with monosyllabic responses. The agency through which we booked lists the Polo as a 4-star hotel. On the basis of our limited experience, this would seem very generous.

Reviews.Title: “Simply terrible”
Reviews.Author: Delo67
Reviews.Content: Just do not go! Dirty, the tinest room i had ever seen, had to walk for 45 min to go to via veneto instead of the 5 min they had told me!! Food was cold and brekfast really poor

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, distant from city center”
Reviews.Author: DCDolcevita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because we needed to be in this area of town for business, and got a very good deal on it from Expedia ($100 per night). However, this is not where you’d want to be for a leisure visit to Rome, unless you planned to spend your whole time at the Villa Borghese. The neighborhood is upscale and there is a train station a short walk away that links up (one stop) to the metro system (separate lines and systems), but it took about 30-45 minutes to walk to Piazza del Popolo. The room was small but clean, modern and comfortable, with no real frills (fully stocked refrigerator but no safe). The TV did not work at all, although we never complained about it. The bathroom was larger than many, with a stall shower but no tub, while the breakfast buffet was the best we’ve had during our 6 weeks (so far) in Italy – hot scrambled eggs and bacon, and a large selection of other items. We could not get the internet connection in the room to work, so they let us use the ancient and slow terminal in the lobby for free. Staff were reasonably helpful and friendly. We would recommend this hotel only if you don’t mind being a bit removed from the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: crew406
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in Parioli due to the proximity of ffamily we were visiting in Rome. While a bit out of the way of tourist attractions, the hotel was clean and quite comfortable. Buses were a short walking distance away and taxi's will come to the hotel. We had a small but ample two bedroom unit which was very nicely decorated. Lighting is a bit dim compared to the States. Heating was very comfortable and extra blankets were available in the room. We would have liked extra pillows and more towels. The room was serviced daily. The shower was a bit cramped but the water was hot and was not lacking in water pressure. (There is no hotel store so try to remember to pack everything you will need.) The adjustable hand held feature was very nice. We could only find one outlet in the entire two bedroom unit to charge our cameras and cell phones with a converter. We ended up charging in cycles and on one occasion we had to set our alarm to get up during the nite to charge another unit (there were three of us with cell phones and cameras with one available outlet in the two bedrooms) Please bring your own radio or alarm cliock as none was provided. There was a phone in the bathroom and the master bedroom. Breakfast was more than ample but we agree that the staff needs to learn how to cook the bacon--it was limp and undercooked! We were allowed to check-in early which was a great convenience due to our early arrival from the airport. The daytime desk staff were not very friendly or helpful. They tried to charge us double the amount we had been quoted on the internet. Bring your reservations and any other info in writing to verify your billing. Great stay for the cost!

Reviews.Title: “good find”
Reviews.Author: Bocman
Reviews.Content: overall it is worth 3-star prices it is charging. You will not find here luxorious accomodations, pool or a full-size bath. However, why would you: it is *** hotel. Friendly people, all speak english, clean room, clean bathroom, wireless internet included. Breakfast is included. I found it very easy to get to. 5-min walk from Euclid train station. e7 to get to Termini on taxi. Behind hotel there is an Angelico's restaurant: it appeared to be fairly priced and food was excellent by my standard.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accom”
Reviews.Author: SL1985
Reviews.Content: This is hotel was very clean which is a priority but our room was also very small but at the same time cosy. It is a bit out of the way but if you can work the metro station it would be fine. Breakfast was fantastic but the staff came across a bit rude and it seemed to be a bother to help us. Nice area though within walking distance to the metro station and some great restaurants and bar

Reviews.Title: “Mind the steps”
Reviews.Author: AnonEmouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of town but has a couple of bars/ristorante nearby. The staff were always polite but sometimes not helpful. The rooms are of a good standard but suffer from some dated pschedelic wallpaper. I also found the lighting in the bathroom inadequate, seemingly just the one small light at the end. There is also a balcony on which to sit.......or put your umbrella! The breakfast, consisted of fruit, bacon, scrambled eggs, croisantes, danish pastries, juice, coffee, tea; all self-service. Note that if you are travelling with someone infirm or disabled then there will be problems as the entrance is approached by many steps and no hand rail. Lastly, note that if you walk to the Villa Borghese don't go along Via Michele as this is where the Israeli embassy is and you will be harassed by the police! Overall, I would say that this is a decent hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5 min walking distance from metro station. I recommend to buy 1 euro OW metro ticket to get into city center and afterwards discover Rome on foot as major tourist attractions are within walking distance. If you're not kin on walking then you can buy 4 euro ticket which is valid whole day. The hotel is standard one with standard service. The breakfast was OK, except for scrambled eggs which they managed to spoil - do not ask me how - but it was impossible to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnKirk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and found the hotel a really pleasant retreat from the mad bustle of downtown Rome. Staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast was OK with fresh fruit and light on the grease. Good standard decor. Everything worked. Aircon was a bit weak and ineffective (Room 111) at this time of the year. Easy walk to Euclide metro stop or 910 bus down to Termini station. Very wealthy part of town - lots of Porsche and Ferraris, and suitably snobby individual walking their poodles. These snobby people were, however, quite helpful in giving directions when asked. World Cup celebrations apaprt this is a quiet area with little traffic noise. The rooms are double glazed. Close to the Villa Borghese park - 10 mins and the Museum of Modern Art - well wortht a visit - never seen Chini's work before - stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations, But not a walking distance to City Center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our train from Paris arrived in Rome by about 7am Rome time, so when we got to the hotel, it was too early to check in, but they did take our luggage and safely stored them in a room while we walked around town until check-in time (which they allowed us to do at around 11am). We asked the lady at the front desk where the nearest Internet Cafe was, and she gave us a map and indicated which Metro line to take to the nearest Piazza -- unfortunately, we didnt find out until the day we checked out that they actually had an internet room in the hotel (why she didn't mention that to us, I will never know). I wouldn't suggest taking the Metro. When we walked to the nearest Metro Station about 5-10 minute walk away, we waited nearly half an hour for the nearest train to arrive, and when it did, it was PACKED wall to wall with people. My husband and I wound up taking Taxis the remainder of our time there. The Polo hotel is very close to the Borghese Gallery, which is an excellent museum, but that's about it. Everything else - Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colliseum, Forum, Piazza Navona, etc. are all kinda far. But since we took taxis, it only cost about 6-10 euro per ride, depending on where you are going -- well, I guess that did tend to get sort of expensive. In the three days that we stayed at the Polo Hotel, I would guess that we spent somewhere between 100-200 euros on taxis. The taxi stand is less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel - just about a block away. Taxis were by far the most convenient transportation for us -- dropped us off exactly where we wanted to go, so we never got lost. The hotel itself was nice - the manager in the restaurant is awesome, as well as the bartenders. We had drinks there in the hotel restaurant at the end of each of our night. The hotel breakfast is delivered to your room for just 3 euros extra, and they loaded us up with food (cooked eggs, fresh fruit, breads, etc). The bathroom in our room was nice -- actually the biggest bathroom that we had compared to London and Paris hotels that we stayed at. There is no smoking in the hotel at all. Oh, and our air conditioner in the room never seemed to work, but we never bothered reporting it either. And it was pretty warm when we were there. Felt like summer already. They didn't have any tourist tour info at all at the front desk. We had to go into town to get info on tourist places, restaurants, etc. Luckily we also had our Frommer's Rome day by day book. Don't forget to bring a small Italian Phrase book- mine was from Lonely Planet "Fast Talk Italian" and fits in your backpocket -- that was our security blanket and saving grace while we were there. They do speak english at the hotel, so that was no problem, but since the hotel is in a residential area, away from tourist places, you will need the phrasebook. People in town are very cooperative, as long as you at least try to speak the language. We stayed at his hotel from 05/15 - 05/18 - Overall, I kinda wished we picked a hotel closer to tourist spots, although this hotel was very nice. Hope this info helps! I will post pics of our room in a few days -- standard room, there were other nicer rooms there.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle!”
Reviews.Author: Magsmor
Reviews.Content: Ideal base for your stay in Rome. Quiet residential area with good local facilities and where the staff are friendly and helpful. The room was very clean although the decorations are quite dark.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short holiday in Rome, staying at the Hotel Polo. The hotel was very good, excellent breakfast, good size bedroom, and ensuite facilities. This hotel is in a nice neighbourhood, a short walk from the Villa Borghese. We would recommend booking in advance to go to the Museum/Gallery there. Alice & David Element

Reviews.Title: “Nice escape from town”
Reviews.Author: hullen
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Polo Hotel. The hotel was very clean and well maintained, and the people at the front desk were very accommodating with directions and maps. (We especially enjoyed chatting with the night manager!) There is also a wonderful restaurant called Angelica's just up the street! We had only two complaints. Unless you are the size of a four year-old, it is most difficult to utilize the toilet in its location directly against the shower. Secondly, the hotel is located in a quiet residential area where the dogs tend to "do their business" all over the sidewalk. My advice is to watch your step! If you don't mind taking the train one stop to access the A line on the metro, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The hotel's proximity to the park also enabled us to take a couple of wonderful leisurely strolls into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Angelico Ristorante & the north train line”
Reviews.Author: jimbobjohnboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polo 8 days during the Christmas holidays. The hotel was clean, the maid service, excellent, and the staff, friendly. However, our room was rather small, even by European standards. The breakfast buffet was very good, but we don’t recommend the restaurant for dinner. Service was slow, and the food, barely warm. One cook plus one server is a formula for inefficient service. There is a supermarket 150 meters from the hotel, and several small food shops nearby. We REALLY enjoyed the restaurant around the corner, next to the movie theater. The waiters were very helpful and friendly, and the proprietor checked on us regularly to see how we enjoyed the meal. They also brought us extras, such as champagne aperitifs, appetizers, and desserts. The filet was heavenly, the salads, delicious, and the oven-baked potatoes, superb. All the servers were good; the waiter, “Carmine” was great: Angelico Ristorante; Via L. Luciani, 52. The hotel's location is particularly nice, being only two blocks from a train line that runs every 15 minutes or so. This line is not marked on most street maps, but a 1-, 3-, or 7-day metro pass is also good for the intercity part of this line. To get to the hotel, take the metro line A to Flaminia, take the far right exit, and the train station is only 30 meters to the right. Hop on the train and get off 3-4 minutes later at the first stop, Euclide. Go up to the street (left exit), turn left, and walk 2 blocks straight up to the hotel. Maps of Rome tend to be confusing, but with a little skill, you can walk from the hotel to the Borghese Museum in only 15 minutes. Only superlatives can describe this museum, but you MUST have a reservation beforehand. Visits are limited to 2 hours. Given the hotel’s amenities, it’s proximity to the train and the Angelico, we will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did get a feel for being in a Rome neighborhood by being in this Hotel. The staff in the restuarant was pleasant and quite helpful. However, the front desk staff was less then helpful with most things that we asked. So don't plan on getting a lot of info about food, sites or your room. Our air conditioning didn't work and they never did seem to get it going. I would recommend staying closer to rome center unless you like to walk 20 minutes to start to get into the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Think before you book”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay in this hotel. The location of the hotel is in a very quiet area on the outskirts of Rome. If you want to be close to The Gallery borghese and The Gallery of Modern Art then you are in walking distance of both. If you prefer to be in the middle of the city then don't choose this hotel. You will need to walk to the nearest train station (Euclides), which is a good 5 minute walk from the hotel, and get of 10-15 minutes later at Flaminio station, in the heart of Rome. The hotel itself is clean and tidy and the staff although not overly friendly seem to be somewhat interested in there guests. The main problem with this hotel is the restaurant. I have to say that a new outside organisation had only just taken over the restaurant 5 days before our stay but this was no excuse for probably the worst hotel meal I have ever had. The meal was prepared by a chef that has no interest in food. It was unimaginative, bland and boring. do not eat in this restaurant if you like food. The service was friendly and welcoming, thanks to the maitre de. Next time i'm in Rome I will not use this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Polo was a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Polo is a very friendly and well appointed hotel in a pleasant suburban area of Rome and within walking distance of the Borghese Gardens. The service was very friendly and the breakfast was more than adequate. It was a quick taxi ride from the city. The rooms may be on the small side but leave nothing unprovided and are very clean. Maybe the Polo is starting to look a little tired (worn curtains, some damage around power sockets) but it is by no means old or worn out. The restaurant recommendation, again a short walk, was just perfect for a last night in Italy.

HotelInfo.Name: Polo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Bartolomeo Gastaldi 4, 00197 Rome, Italy
